engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Transforming prey into forms that support the survival and growth of other organisms.
Having specialized structures and functions to locate, capture, and process prey.
Using sensory structures to detect prey.
Using physical structures for capturing and consuming prey, such as jaws, teeth, and claws.
Having structures for digesting and absorbing nutrients from prey.

engineering_design_principles.description: Optimization of Hunting and Foraging Strategies
engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Using geometry and mathematical relationships to optimize hunting and foraging strategies.
Ensuring that the body can withstand the demands of capturing and consuming prey through efficient design.
Ensuring that the body can withstand the demands of capturing and consuming prey through durable design.
